sn19.21:4.1: “Just now, Reverend, as I was descending from Vulture’s Peak Mountain I saw a female novice flying through the air.
sn19.21:4.2: Her outer robe, bowl, belt, and body were burning, blazing and glowing
sn19.21:4.6: That there can be such a sentient being,
sn19.21:5.1: Then the Buddha said to the mendicants:
sn19.21:5.2: “Mendicants, there are disciples who live full of vision and knowledge,
sn19.21:5.3: since a disciple knows, sees, and witnesses such a thing.
sn19.21:5.4: Formerly, I too saw that female novice, but I did not speak of it.
sn19.21:5.6: For if I had spoken of it others would not have believed me,
sn19.21:5.7: which would be for their lasting harm and suffering.
sn19.21:5.8: That female novice used to be an bad female novice in the time of Buddha Kassapa’s dispensation.
sn19.21:5.9: As a result of that deed she burned in hell for many years, many hundreds, many thousands, many hundreds of thousands of years. Now she experiences the residual result of that deed in such an incarnation.”
sn19.21:10.1: The Linked Discourses with Lakkhaṇa are complete.
